intro: Blitum capitatum subsp. hastatum, commonly known as the prairie cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, showy, pink to purple flower that blooms in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies, rocky slopes, and disturbed soils. It has hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, serrated edge, and its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. This species is relatively hardy and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
